translated: Itivuttaka
The Group of Threes
The Fifth Section
Generosity

analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha:
“Monks, there are these two kinds of gifts:

original: āmisadānañca dhammadānañca.🔽Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ dvinnaṁ dānānaṁ yadidaṁ dhammadānaṁ.
analyzed: āmisa dānañca dhamma dānañca  etat agga bhikkhave imesam dvinnam dānānam yat idam dhamma dāna
translated: the gift of material things and the gift of the Dhamma.🔽Between these two kinds of gifts, the gift of the Dhamma is said to be the more excellent one.
There are these two kinds of sharing:

original: āmisasaṁvibhāgo ca dhammasaṁvibhāgo ca.🔽Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ dvinnaṁ saṁvibhāgānaṁ yadidaṁ dhammasaṁvibhāgo.
analyzed: āmisa savibhāgo ca dhamma savibhāgo ca  etat agga bhikkhave imesam dvinnam savibhāgānam yat idam dhamma savibhāgaḥ
translated: the sharing of material things and the sharing of the Dhamma.🔽Between these two kinds of sharing, the sharing of the Dhamma is said to be the more excellent one.
There are these two kinds of assistance:

analyzed: āmisa anuggahaḥ ca dhamma anuggahaḥ ca
translated: assistance with material things and assistance with the Dhamma.

original: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ dvinnaṁ anuggahānaṁ yadidaṁ dhammānuggaho”ti.🔽Etamatthaṁ bhagavā avoca.
analyzed: etat agga bhikkhave imesam dvinnam anuggahānam yat idam dhamma anuggaho ti  etam attham bhagavān avoca
translated: Between these two kinds of assistance, assistance with the Dhamma is said to be the more excellent one.”🔽The Blessed One said this.
And in connection with this, it was said:
“The gift they call the highest, unsurpassed,
The sharing the Blessed One has praised,
With a confident mind in the supreme field,

original: Viññū pajānaṁ ko na yajetha kāle.
analyzed: viññū pajānam kaḥ na yajetha kāle
translated: The wise one, understanding, when the time comes, should make an offering.
Those who speak and those who listen, both of them,
Those who speak and listen with a serene mind to the Dispensation of the One of Good Guidance,
Their meaning is purified to the highest degree,
Those who are heedful in the Dispensation of the One of Good Guidance.”

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: This is the meaning of what was said by the Blessed One, so I have heard.
The ninth section on “The One of Good Guidance.”
